intro: Rinorea punctata, commonly known as the spotted rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. Rinorea punctata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
